answers.answer: Transient blurry vision can occur with blood sugar fluctuations.  Your HbA1C should be monitored and kept as low as possible.  Once your blood sugar is stable, a repeat refraction for new glasses can be done.  You also need a dilated eye exam with an ophthalmologist to rule out any retinal complications from your diabetes.

question: Hello my names is James. I am 27 years old and I have a question. For the past few years I have had  blurry vision with distant objects that usually lasts for 2 weeks and then they go away...I found that  this occurs during the spring and summer times. I went to see my eye doctor when I had this problem in August and after tests they said my eyes were fine. I do have Type 2 diabetes which is now running a little high right now at 155 and also have high blood pressure
title: Blurry vision
